data.title: Abimbola Ogunlusi on LinkedIn: Spaghetti a la Bolognese is a pasta dish originating in Italy and the…
data.meta_description: Spaghetti a la Bolognese is a pasta dish originating in Italy and the region of Bologna. It is considered healthy if cooked with lean ground, or minced beef…
data.text:
What Is Kimchi? Kimchi is a traditional Korean dish whose components can vary but usually include some combination of vegetables, garlic, ginger, chili peppers, salt, and fish sauce. The mix is pickled and fermented, which was originally a way to preserve the vegetables for the winter months. Cabbage is the most common vegetable used to make kimchi although carrots, radish, cucumber, and scallions are also frequently used, too. There are hundreds of kimchi recipes that vary depending on the region and season in which they are produced, and it's very easy to make it a vegan dish by keeping all the ingredients plant-based. Kimchi is available commercially and isn't expensive, but it can be fun to put together your own based on preferences. It can take a little bit of time to prepare the vegetables, but like other fermented foods (e.g., bread, beer, and kombucha), it's mostly a hands-off experience. It will develop its flavors and its nutritional profile during that process. Kimchi keeps for a while, making it an economical, versatile, and easy-to-prepare food item to have in the fridge. #snsinstitutions #snsdesignthinkers #snsdesignthinking #snsct

Happy Dry Pasta January! Yesterday we announced this first annual celebration and starting today we will give you at least one reason you should eat and celebrate dried pasta. 🤌 First, when we say “eat more dried pasta” we don’t mean that you should nash your teeth on uncooked pasta. We’re talking about cooking high quality dried pasta. We’ve got nothing against fresh pasta, heck we make the best fresh pasta on the Central Coast (in my humble opinion🍝 ) But we all know it’s not always practical to make or get fresh pasta. Dried pasta is just as tasty and actually more versatile than fresh pasta. For one thing it has an incredibly long shelf life and it’s so much easier to make it al dente ( which actually has a real heath benefit. More on that next week) Did you know that a high quality pasta like Etto , made with organic semolina and slowly dried is a high protein, complex carbohydrate and low glycemic food? Yep, it’s gotten a bad rap for far too long. One etto, which is 100grams has 13-14grams of protein. The complex carbohydrate takes longer for the body to break down so there are no sugar spikes. The low glycemic value means low in sugar compared to most other foods including many vegetables. so stay tuned to learn more about dried pasta and how to prepare it. #pasta #etto #italianfoodlover #healthypasta #semolinaflour #ettopasta

High-Protein Rice & Beans Bowl 🥣 Elevate your taste buds with this nourishing Vegan Power Bowl, featuring black rice, roasted sweet potatoes, golden tofu, and a rich bean chili! Ingredients: -Black rice -Sweet potatoes, cubed -Firm tofu, diced -Bean chili (choose your favorite beans) -Spices (cumin, chili powder, garlic) -Liquid amino for a healthy, savory tofu seasoning Steps: 1️⃣ Cook black rice as per instructions. 2️⃣ Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil, roast until tender. 3️⃣ Pan-fry tofu with liquid amino until it's savory and golden. 4️⃣ Simmer beans with spices to make a hearty chili. (I just buy microwavable beans to save time) 5️⃣ Assemble your bowl and savor every bite! Dive into this balance of complex carbs and protein, perfect for post-workout recovery. 💬 Craving more wholesome recipes? Comment "TOFU" for my 'Macro Mastery' e-book, full of healthy, quick-prep meals! #VeganRecipe #HealthyEating

Delicious Instant Pot KETO Style #Turkey Soup Recipe The one thing that has been a struggle for me on the Keto diet is not being able to find a soup that I can make that doesn't have a lot of carbs in it. So, I decided to make one of my own Instant Pot Keto Style Turkey Soup recipe. Some important things to know about this recipe. Browning the turkey breast really does bring out the meat's flavor so be sure to do this part of the recipe. Adding the herbs and avocado oil to the turkey breast and the peppers, onions, and celery gives a balanced flavor to the different parts of the soup. Instant Pot KETO Style Turkey Soup Recipe Ingredients: 3 tsp Avocado Oil (1 tsp, 1 tsp, 1 tsp) 3 garlic cloves minced 1 can diced tomato (canned) 1 cup onion chopped 1 cup celery chopped 1 cup yellow pepper chopped 1 can of sliced black olives 1 tsp salt 1 - 2 lb turkey breast Visit the blog for more details. #sabrinasorganizing https://lnkd.in/du4ZQAsH #Dinner #instantpotrecipe #Weeknight #turkeybreast

How good does this look for a winter meal?! Chopped Power Salad with Chicken Ingredients ~ ¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil 3 tablespoons lemon juice 1 clove garlic, grated ½ teaspoon dried oregano ½ teaspoon sugar ¼ teaspoon salt ¼ teaspoon ground pepper 4 cups torn green-leaf lettuce 4 cups baby spinach 2 cups shredded cooked chicken 1 cup halved grape tomatoes 1 cup halved and sliced cucumber ½ cup slivered red onion ⅓ cup sliced pepperoncini ⅓ cup crumbled feta cheese 2 tablespoons toasted unsalted sunflower seeds Instructions ~ Whisk oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, sugar, salt and pepper together in a large bowl. Add lettuce, spinach, chicken, tomatoes, cucumber, onion and pepperoncini; toss to coat. Serve sprinkled with feta and sunflower seeds. Recipe from Eating Well. ENJOY! For more delish recipes that taste amazing, be sure to register for my workshop tomorrow on "How and Why to Break Free from the Sugar Habit," where I'm giving away my guide on how to indulge your sweet tooth, hiqh quality style. Join us via link in comments.

Here is a yummy and easy grain-free granola recipe I found: Ingredients ⅓ cup Certified Organic Coconut Cream ⅔ cup Almond Butter (or any nut butter you prefer) 1 cup of assorted Chopped Nuts and Seeds of your liking Sea salt, to taste (optional) Nutmeg, freshly ground, to taste (optional) Cinnamon, to taste (optional) Cayenne Pepper, to taste (optional) ¼ teaspoon Vanilla (optional) Stevia, to taste (optional) Instructions 1. Place all ingredients and seasonings in a bowl and mix thoroughly 2. Scoop the mixture into a Ziploc baggie and close it 3. Lay the bag flat on the countertop and press down the mixture until flat 4. Place the bag in the refrigerator until the mixture firms up 5. You can either crumble it like granola or break it in to bars or bite size chunks to be eaten later 6. This needs to be kept refrigerated as it will soften once removed Enjoy! Go to Acunatural’s website for many more healthy recipes. https://lnkd.in/gkbnwe5c Photo by Heather Barnes on Unsplash

𝟱 𝗜𝗻𝗴𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗪𝗵𝗶𝘁𝗲 𝗖𝗵𝗶𝗰𝗸𝗲𝗻 𝗖𝗵𝗶𝗹𝗶 🤤I’ve got a delicious 15-minute dinner recipe for you today… This White Chicken Chili is a great way to use leftover chicken. You also can make it with turkey. The best part about this recipe is the variety… You can eat it as-is or top it with diced avocado, shredded cheese, and/or chopped cilantro – or any of your other favorite chili toppings. TIP: If you have more time, you can even add more veggies – simply saute onions, carrots, celery, etc., in olive oil in the pot before adding the rest of the ingredients! 5 Ingredient White Chicken Chili (serves 4) 4 cups (950 ml) low-sodium stock (chicken or vegetable) 4 cups (600 g) cooked chicken, shredded (or 2 boneless chicken breasts) 2 (15-ounce) cans pinto or great northern beans, drained and rinsed 16 oz (425 g) jar of salsa verde 2 tsp ground cumin Combine all the ingredients in a large pot and bring to a simmer at medium-high heat. When it starts to bubble, reduce the heat to medium-low and continue simmering for 5-10 minutes. Ladle into bowls and enjoy with your favorite toppings! (And as always, tag me with a photo if you make this one — or leave a comment and tell me how you made it your own!)

3 Ways to Make Sticky Cauliflower Rice [Low Carb] Yes, you can still enjoy eating sushi without all those carbs. All you need is some sticky cauliflower rice, and you can easily make it yourself. In fact, I've included 3 different recipes. They are really simple and don't require many ingredients. One recipe uses gelatin as binder, the second uses coconut cream and the third utilizes rice wine vinegar with lower-glycemic coconut sugar. The recipe you like best https://lnkd.in/gD6CJ_8S #cauliflowerricerecipes
